page.title: 11THE "WARMINSTER JOURNAL"
page.content: For a town of 15000 people, Warminster is unusual and lucky to have its own local newspaper, the "Warminster Journal", founded in 1881 and still run as a family business from Coates and Parkers shop. Surprisingly, this was not the first paper in the town, which had a monthly "Miscellany" even in the 1850s. In 1985 it takes only 11 full-time workers to produce the "Journal". The editor is Mrs Gladys Shorto. News is collected by the paper's sole reporter, award-winning journalist Mr Kevin Mount. Printing starts every Tuesday and ends by Thursday afternoon when about 5600 copies are distributed throughout the surrounding area. As for the future, Mr Mount thinks computers will be used increasingly to produce the paper more efficiently and help the "Journal" survive its second century.
